ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests1.desc: Place a &6Melter&r on top of a &6Heater&r.
You can now melt metals. Try inserting some Raw Iron into the Melter!
Melting raw ores in the Melter will provide you with 4 ingots of metal per 3 raw ore!
You can extract liquids from the Melter using &6Create pipes&r or &6Hephaestus Faucets&r.
The molten metal will be also used later for &6alloys&r. More on that later.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests2.desc: Smelt some &6Grout&r using a Furnace or by Bulk Blasting.
Seared Bricks are an integral component for various Melter-related things!
As a reward, you will get a book that explains many things about the Melter usage.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests3.desc: Don't forget about Ponder - it will explain most of the Fluid Pipe mechanics.
However, simply conntecting two Tanks with a Pipe won't work.
You must use a &6Mechanical Pump&r to force the flow.
Mechanical Pumps can push and pull liquids &625&r blocks from the pump.
Fluid Pipes can only contain one liquid at a time - if two different liquids meet in a pipe, the pipe will break.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests4.desc: This chapter's already a doozy to look at, yeah?
The Andesite World eased you in, but manufacturing will become more complicated as your crafting techniques expand and resources begin requiring multiple steps.
It all builds on stuff you've already learned, so it's all about improving your craft.
You'll find in this chapter that gathering and managing base resources will become more and more of a hassle.
You will need to begin semi or fully automating basic resources, as crafting everything on demand will become unsustainable.
But the beauty of industrialization is that you have the power to decide what you need and the tools and tenacity to manufacture limitless amounts of it.
There is no one true path to success: let your problem-solving skills be your ultimate guide.
Overcome the revolution of industry and the Moon will welcome you to explore its wonders.
New resources will be found that can further improve your automation efficiency and capabilities.
Plus, any production lines set up this chapter will provide for you for the rest of the game.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests5.desc: &6Spouts&r spout fluids onto items to create new items.
They can also interact with some blocks, like Hephaestus Basins and Casting Tables.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests6.desc: &6Item Drains&r have the ability to drain liquid from liquid-containing items, such as buckets and bottles.
&6Hose Pulleys&r can fill or drain a body of liquid, up to the certain threshold. &410k Fluid pools have been removed!&r There are many recipes for automating Lava instead. Check REI :)
&6Portable Fluid Interfaces&r operate much like Portable Storage Interfaces, but they interact with fluids and Tanks on the Contraption instead.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests7.desc: Put a &6Faucet&r on the side or below the Melter or any other Tank.
Put a Casting Basin, Table or a Tank below the Faucet to transfer the liquid to them.
Now, you can right-click the Faucet to start pouring liquids!
You can power the Faucet with Redstone in order to cast continuously!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests8.desc: &6Casting Basins and Tables&r allow you to shape molten metal into various forms: blocks, ingots, tool parts - you name it!
&6Casts&r are required to craft ingots, nuggets and tool parts.
&6Sand Casts&r can be swiftly created, however they only last for 1 use.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests9.desc: The &6Explorer's Compass&r will lead you to a variety of different structures!
I would not recommend searching for a &7Stronghold&r. The End Portal does not work.
You can also find &6Shimmer Lakes&r, which will be important pretty soon...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests11.des: Instead, you will build a &9Moon&r portal!
Place &6Shimmering Stone&r in a shape of a regular portal.
Then, ignite the portal with the &6Astral Conduit&r!
Make sure to have a Space Suit equipped!
- Trains CAN go through Moon portals.
- The quest reward allows you to have a portal with filled corners without wasting additional Shimmer or Moon Stone!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests13.sub: Loads Oxygen into your Space Suit!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests13.des: No power is needed to this machine to load Oxygen into your Space Suit!
Also, be aware that this pack changes many recipes - you can't create &7Oxygen&r from &7Water&r here, use an &6Electrolyzer&r.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests14.des: Don't confuse this with a Tech Reborn Electrolyzer!
Ponder the Electrolyzer to learn how to build it.
If the multiblock is done correctly, the Electrolyzer will start producing Oxygen.
Pump Oxygen from the Electrolyzer - you don't need filters as Oxygen is the only liquid that can be extracted.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests15.des: &6Electron Tubes&r are used in advanced Create technology.
So far, there's not much use for them, but when you get access to Brass, they will become important.

Tip: To polish Rose Quartz manually, hold &6Sand Paper&r in one hand, &6Rose Quartz&r in other, and hold Right-Click. To polish Rose Quartz automatically, you can use a Deployer! Note that Sand Paper breaks after 8 uses.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests16.sub: This will be terrible for the Industrial Revolution.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests16.des: &6Redstone Chips&r are circuits specialized for radio equipment - like radios from Phonos.
They will be used for the next thing required to go to the Moon.
Make sure to craft more than one of these - you will need multiple!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests17.sub: What a nice alloy, I hope I dont need to make loads of it...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests17.des: &6Rose Gold&r is an alloy of &6Molten Copper&r and &6Molten Gold&r.
By mixing them in the Basin, of course!
Pump &6Molten Gold&r and &6Molten Copper&r into the Basin.
Don't worry - Basins only accept up to 1 bucket of each fluid.
The resulting &6Rose Gold&r can be either pumped out with an aid of a &6Smart Fluid Pipe&r, or by placing another &6Basin&r or an &6Item Drain&r diagonally downwards relative to the basin.
The recipe you are performing is mixing &6molten metals&r, not &6ingots&r!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests19.des: &6Shimmer&r can be found in underground &6Shimmer Lakes&r, which can be found with a use of a Structure Compass.
Alternatively, Shimmer can be produced in a multitude of ways by mixing Amethyst with various other glowy ingredients. Check the recipe browser!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests20.des: &6Copper Casings&r are largely used for fluid machines, much like Andesite Casings used for kinetic machines.
Copper Casings can also cover pipes, locking their connections with neighboring blocks - check out the Ponder for more info.
When making the next tier of casings, you'll be needing a lot of the previous tiered stuff too.
As such, automation is recommended to make the production easier.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests21.des: You can produce Andesite Alloy with &6triple&r efficiency using a Mechanical Mixer.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests22.des: The &6Tinker's Anvil&r allows you to assemble tools, just like the Tinker Station.
However, unlike Tinker Station, it can produce &6broad tools&r too, such as Broad Axes, Sledge Hammers, or Excavators.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests23.sub: Bronze is a great material for your Hephaestus tools!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests24.des: &9Luck&r works like Fortune and Looting combined!
It's an &6ability&r, so it uses a special Ability slot to apply.
Further levels of this modifier don't require any modifier slots.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests27.sub: Spread across the Overworld and Moon, you might uncover a buried meteor filled with Shimmer...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests27.des: Pumping this and shipping it off to your base might be wise, Shimmer is a valuable resource to control.
&7If you choose to use the Explorer's Compass, remember that Shimmer Lakes form at around Y=-24!&r
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests29.des: By mixing Copper and Tin Ingots in a Basin using a Mechanical Mixer, you can produce Bronze with double efficiency!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests30.sub: You can cast Cogwheels out of Molten Bronze!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests30.des: You can use &6Coin Casts&r to cast &nSmall Cogwheels&r.
You can use &6Gear Casts&r to cast &nLarge Cogwheels.
This method is more expensive in Bronze, but you won't use any Andesite Alloy!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests31.des: For the new inventions, a new resource will be needed - &6Sap&r.
First, find some Rubber Trees - they are common in Plains or in Forests.
Then, use a &6Treetap&r on a Log that has Sap on it to extract it.
You can also mill Rubber Logs for Sap.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests32.sub: Mix up some Sap in a Mixer and get this lovely substance!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests32.des: &6Rubber&r is used for a lot of important things.
You'll want to farm some Sap.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests33.des: &6Mechanical Belts&r can move items on them around.
Items dropped onto the Belt will be placed on it.
Items on the Belt can be bulk-processed, although sometimes the automation might get stuck - Use a &6Depot&r at the end of the Belt line to prevent items from being stuck.
Mechanical Belts can also insert items to Chutes, Millstones, or aforementioned Depots, placed one block behind the end of the belt.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests34.des: &6Sturdy Chests&r hold 54 stacks of items - 9 more than Copper Chests!
That &6Sturdy Chest&r you earned from the Traveler's Armor quest in Chapter 0.5 doesn't count.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests35.des: The &6Deployer&r is very special - it acts as a player Right-Clicking or Left-Clicking.
Deployers always interact with things 2 blocks ahead of itself. It can place blocks, feed animals, use a Bucket... It can do a lot!
Deployers can also be used in a new type of recipe - deploying items onto other items on a Depot or a Belt.
To craft them, you will need Polished Rose Quartz. Hold &6Sand Paper&r in one hand, &6Rose Quartz&r in the other, and hold Right-Click.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests36.des: &6Andesite Funnels&r can extract items from the inventory, 1 item at a time.
They can either place items on the Belt or Depot, or drop items in-world if there are neither.
Very useful to kickstart the belt spaghetti.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests37.des: - Contents of Chutes, Tunnels, or Tanks
- Exact readouts from Speedometer and Stressometer
- SU generation rates for stress generators and boilers
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests38.des: Mechanical Bearings can attach to a structure on top.
When activated, the resulting contraption will start spinning, and all actors (Mechanical Saws, Drills, Deployers, etc.) will activate.
Blocks destroyed by actors such as Mechanical Saws and Drills will be inserted into a Chest, Barrel, Vault or a Toolbox on a contraption, if present.
To extract items from the contraption, use &6Portable Storage Interfaces&r.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests39.sub: The days of manual harvesting are over.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests39.des: They are smart enough to only harvest fully-grown tools - additionally crops collected by Mechanical Harvester will be automatically replanted!
&6Kelp&r will be used a lot in the future - make sure to make a large farm!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests40.sub: I'm addicted to these belt things...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests40.des: Having wet &6Kelp&r doesn't help you much.
Before Kelp goes to the final destination, it'd be best if you &6Bulk Smoke&r it on the way.
(Dried Kelp is a food item! Bulk Blasting it will burn it!)
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests41.sub: Remember the Mechanical Saw from the last chapter?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests41.des: If you put them on a moving contraption, they should do exactly what you'd expect.
That being said, one caveat of automatic farming is that trees need to be replanted.
- Put them above the Saws or on the opposite side of the arm
- Equip them with Saplings. Make sure that Deployers are facing down.
Trees that are cut down will provide you with more Saplings.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests42.des: Tree farms produce &6Logs&r, &6Sticks&r and &6Saplings&r - you probably won't want to keep all of them at once, or else your farm will start spilling items!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests43.sub: I want minerals for a healthy factory lifestyle.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests43.des: Washing Red Sand gives you 33%% chance of getting &6Zinc Nuggets&r and 12%% chance of getting Dead Bushes.
Your only two options for automating Red Sand at this point are milling Terracotta blocks or Granite, both of which are quite slow to produce.
You can go back to this automation later, or wash Red Sand obtained from digging from Badlands.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests44.sub: You may have built this dozens of times already.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests44.des: Washing Gravel gives 25%% chance of getting &6Flint&r and 12%% chance of getting &6Iron Nuggets&r.
If you have lots of spare &6Tuff&r, you can Mill it to get 1 &6Iron Nugget&r.
You can automate Gravel by milling Cobblestone.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests45.des: Sand can be washed for 25%% chance of getting &6Clay&r.
There's a 25%% chance of getting Gravel from milling Sand. Not too efficient, but it will do.
Alternatively, you can produce Dripstone blocks and mill them into Clay.
The setup requires either a big vanilla farm or Calcite automation, so get your Moss farm prepared!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests46.des: If you have Belts going through walls, or if you don't want to accidentally drop an item onto the Belt from above, &6Andesite Tunnels&r can cover them.
If there's a Belt perpendicular to the main Belt, and the Andesite Tunnel is placed on a junction, the Andesite Tunnel will split one item from the stack on the Belt.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests47.des: The true power of Create isn't in the new crafting techniques it provides, but the ability to automate resources.
- Full automation, where a specific resource will be made until the end of time without any need for the player to touch a system
- Semi-automation, where you only need to periodically restock starting resources or fuel
This pack won't always tell you when to automate and what can be automated. That'll be up to you to decide.
That being said, we'll occasionally make diamond-shaped automation quests, to either let you know that a new automation opportunity exists, or because it's a really strong idea.
You don't need to complete them immediately - just consider starting sometime down the line.
By the way - there may have been some of these automation quests in Chapter 1!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests48.des: Rembember the Track recipe from Chapter 1?
Using &6Deployers&r, you can now create tracks &63 times cheaper&r!
Both Stone Slabs and Iron Nuggets are easily automatable - lurk in REI to find out how!
To complete this quest, create &61000 Tracks&r using the same Mechanical Press.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests49.des: Tunnel bores will mine tunnels for you.
They're stupidly complicated, and it's highly, highly recommended that you watch a guide on YouTube.
That being said, here's the gist:
Any Minecart running under a powered Cart Assembler will turn into a Minecart Contraption.
The entire contraption can be picked up by right-clicking the Minecart with a Wrench.
Running the Minecart Contraption under the unpowered Cart Assembler will turn it back into blocks.

A tunnel bore is a Minecart Contraption with a wall of Mechanical Drills, with Deployers placing Cobblestone/Cobbled Deepslate walls, and with Deployers ahead of Mechanical Drills placing solid blocks to prevent fluids messing up the contraption.
Finally, you create a long neck. The front of the neck has a Deployer to place down Rails, and a Deployers in front of it one block lower to place a floor to place the Rails.
At the back, place a Mechanical Plough that will collect Rails to place them ahead of the Minecart Contraption again.
If you used a Minecart with Furnace to create the Minecart Contraption, any Coal on the contraption will be consumed to propel the Minecart.
You will get stupid amounts of various ores and stones very quickly, although you need to take care of lighting up the tunnels to prevent monsters from spawning.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests50.des: &6Cart Assemblers&r allow you to create Minecart Contraptions - special contraptions that can drive on Rails and can be picked up with a Wrench.
Cart Assemblers are very useful for things done in a straight line, like &6tunnel bores&r.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests51.des: Certain automation processes use animated &6Contraptions&r - for example tree and crop farms.
Super Glue is very convenient for connecting different contraption blocks together.
Though make sure to not accidentally glue a part of your base onto a Contraption!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests52.sub: Trust me. Automate any of these three and fuel will never be an issue again.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests52.des: Complete one of these tasks to complete this quest.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests53.sub: Sand is cool but it goes away.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests53.des: - Place an item in a shape of a cast you want to make, for example: an Axe Head
- Pour 1 ingot worth of Molten Gold onto the Casting Table
This will consume the item, and the freshly created Gold Cast can be used to cast stuff out of molten metal!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests55.sub: The... HUH? What on Earth is this?!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests56.des: &6Windmills&r can spin at speeds between 1 and 16 RPM, depending on the number of sails.
They need more gearshifting, but they generate a ton of Stress Units.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests57.des: &6Item Vaults&r can store 20 stacks of items per block.
Vaults can combine into 1x1x3, 2x2x6 and 3x3x9 multiblocks with total capacity summed up - up to 1620 stacks for a 3x3x9 Vault!
Vaults can only be accessed by automation. That means you have to use Hoppers, Chutes, Funnels, etc. to insert and extract items from Vaults.
Brass Funnels and Smart Chutes will be useful later.
&eWarning&r: Big slotted inventories do not pair well with filtered Brass Funnels/Smart Chutes, if it comes for perfomance.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests58.sub: Carrying buckets from the underground's annoying, isn't it?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests58.des: Place pointed Dripstone underneath a block, and then put a Lava source block above the block. Then, 1-10 blocks below the Dripstone, place a Cauldron.
The Lava from the Cauldron can then be pumped out into a Fluid Tank, giving you a buffer of Lava. A couple recipes involve spouting Lava on materials, so it's handy to have this set up.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests59.des: Allows you to filter what liquid passes through the &6Smart Fluid Pipe&r.
Hephaestus buckets don't render, but they still work as filters.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests60.sub: Seeing how much stock your factories have produced is so satisfying
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests60.des: &6Display Boards&r can show text on a big board.
You can edit their text by clicking on the line with a named Name Tag.
Make sure that the Display Boards' cogs spin with sufficient speed!
&6Display Links&r can take data from various vanilla or Create blocks and show them on the Display Board.
Try creating a Train schedule or a SU monitor with them!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests61.des: Create a Windmill with 128+ Sail-like blocks attached.
You used a ton of Wool for this one, so have a stack of Wool as a reward.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests62.sub: Mechanical Saws on a Train - will they work?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests62.des: Remember in Chapter 1 how you used Glue to assemble Trains? Isn't that similar to what you did with a Cart Assembler and Mechanical Bearing?
Well, it turns out that Trains are in the same family of moving contraptions.
That means that actors like Saws, Drills, Harvesters, Portable Storage Interfaces, etc. will work on Trains and operate like usual.
That means you can build farms that operate with Trains on automated Schedules.
If you want to overkill things this way, then by all means, it's encouraged!
You can even make a Train tunnel bore, although it won't be any easier than using a Cart Assembler.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests63.des: To form your Compound Mixture into an Ingot, you'll need an &6Ingot Cast&r.
Alternatively you can cast whole blocks in a &6Casting Basin&r.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests64.des: You can mill Rubber Logs to produce &6Sap&r. That Sap can be then mixed by Mechanical Mixer into &6Rubber&r.
Consider making an automated Rubber tree farm, as it can also give you most of the things standard Wood can give!
Alternatively, you can use a Deployer to automatically use Treetaps on Rubber Logs to extract Sap from them.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests65.des: The possibilities may be larger than you think. Here are some examples just to give you an idea of the possibilities, whether available now or later:
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests65.tas: There are a lot of options.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests66.des: Walking on &6Andesite Pavement&r will grant you a &6Speed I&r effect.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests67.des: Ye filthy landlubbers can't even walk 10 seconds on the ocean floor without spluttering for air.
&6Copper Backtank&rs store compressed air, used by Diving Helmets and some pneumatic tools.
Speaking of the &6Diving Helmet&r - it allows you to breathe underwater and nullifies the mining penalty underwater if the Copper Backtank you wear has air inside.
&6Diving Boots&r allow you to walk and jump underwater instead of swimming. Wearing them, you will no longer be moved by Mechanical Belts.
These three will be useful for creation of a special suit designed to withstand the vacuum of space...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests68.des: Pieces of the Moon remain all over the Overworld. You can stumble upon them in small meteors, in loot chests, on sky islands, or find a large quantity of it near a &6Shimmer Lake&r.
Collect at least &610 Moon Stone&r to make enough Shimmering Stone for a portal.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests69.des: Obtain &6Scorched Basin and Table&r by blasting their Seared counterparts in a Blast Furnace or using Bulk Blasting.
Scorched Basins and Tables only accept liquids when there's a cast!
For example: The Scorched Basin won't accept Molten Clay, when there's no Stone or Andesite in the Basin.
If you for some reason want to cast recipes that don't require a cast, you can use &6Gold Platforms&r and &6Gold Bars&r as an "empty cast".
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests70.des: The Smeltery has been &ndisabled&r in this pack.
In this pack, alloying is done through Create's Mechanical Mixers.
Later on, you will get access to the Foundry, completely skipping the Smeltery.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests71.sub: Exploit liquid manipulation to automate Sturdy Sheets.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests71.des: Generate Obsidian by pouring Lava next to a waterlogged Stair.
Use a Mechanical Drill to mine the Obsidian - it doesn't take a very long time if the drill spins at 256 RPM.
Then mill Obsidian into Powdered Obsidian - there's a chance you will get an Obsidian block back.
Then, you can do one of two paths:
1. Use a Mechanical Press on Powdered Obsidian 10 times - this will produce Sturdy Sheets 60%% of a time,
2. Spout Lava, then press 2 times, loop 5 times - this will give you Sturdy Sheets 100%% of a time.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests72.des: If applied to a Sword, Cleaver, Scythe, or Dagger, it can shear blocks like Shears.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests73.des: &cHaste&r is a really straightforward modifier - it increases mining speed of the tool.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests74.des: Automatable warm ocean no matter where you are at!
&bNote: Press "U" on the Coral in REI to see all the possibilities!
Whilst not a priority right now, do take the time to see the possibilites of &6Crushing&r these blocks later...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests75.sub: 3x3 multiblock which changes block generation based on the stone it's built from!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests75.des: Complimentary schematic included with all purchases! You can also Ponder this block to see more info!
&7Middle Layer: Lava in middle, surrounded by vanilla glass. &r
&7Lower Layer: 3x3 Polished Andesite. Chamber on any central side.&r

The &6Stone Growth Chamber&r, once built correctly, will slowly generate Andesite. This is a healthy upgrade from a Mining Drill cobblegen setup, as Andesite can be milled into Cobblestone, it's less tedious to set up, and the item collection is done for you!
When built using other Polished stone, like Polished Moon Stone, it can generate stone from other planets. &6Don't forget!&r
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests76.sub: Huge ore returns with side products galore!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests76.des: Create Orestones have been changed to be &6fully automatable&r.
The recipes each require a liquid, a block (or two!) and a dye.
Merging these production lines to end in an orestone farm can fund your factories for the foreseeable future.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests77.des: The Fluid Centrifuge refines a liquid to create a new liquid.

&bHold W on the Fluid Centrifuge item to see how it works!&r Essentially, when spinning at 256 RPM, the Fluid Centrifuge takes an input fluid from a Fluid Tank underneath, and outputs a new liquid to a Fluid Tank on top.
&4The Fluid Centrifuge doesn't work very well with REI.&r To see its recipes, you must press U on it. Take note of all these recipes, as they come in handy at various points in progession!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests78.des: The Fluid Centrifuge can be used to refine Horse Urine into Liquid Estrogen. &8(I swear this is scientifically accurate)

Pop an Estrogen Pill and unleash your inner *&dgirl&r*. The ability to air-dash is granted! Bind the dash button to something comfortable in the Controls menu. I recommend a mouse button if you have one spare!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests79.des: Mouth getting sore from eating all those pills? An Estrogen Patch consumes Estrogen Pills automatically from your inventory, and it increases the duration of the effect given! Woohoo!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests80.sub: This is still a tech pack, I swear
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_3.quests80.des: Shimmer can be used to Transmute certain items, transforming them into another item. Press U on a bucket of Shimmer in your inventory to see all of the recipes!
Simply throw a valid item into Shimmer fluid and watch the SCIENCE unfold! Remember your protective goggles!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.title: 3) Remnants of a Lost Civilization
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests0.subt: Obtain a Blaze from a lost Power Plant on the Moon!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests0.desc: Power Plants spawn with dangerous Wither Skeletons and guaranteed Blaze Spawners. With an empty Blaze Burner, you'll be able to Right-Click Blazes and scoop them up.

Blaze Burners let you do heated (and later on, super-heated) recipes, where you can light a fire under a Basin for a Mixer or Press to operate on. A lot of recipes can only be made this way. It's the reason you really should have fuel automated.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests1.desc: Put Brass production into OVERDRIVE as you'll want to use many of its unique tools. Even if you have automation going on, you may want to consider investing in a quarry or tunnel bore so that quick injections of these can be made into your life.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests2.desc: Mechanical Crafters can craft stuff for you. Almost every Crafting Table recipe is supported.
Not only that, but Mechanical Crafters can extend past the normal 3x3 grid available to Tables. A handful of recipes producing large objects can only be made with the help of these machines.
But wait, there's more! The Precision Mechanisms inside allow you to craft certain dedicated hand-crafting recipes, even if they are smaller than a 3x3 grid.
There are so many new recipes that this questbook can't show them all. Check out what you can make with REI!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests3.desc: Precision Mechanisms are used in all sorts of powerful Create utilities. You'll find yourself smiling each time you craft one.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests4.desc: Crushing is a very important industrial process. It has multiple uses:
1) It can "crush" Raw Ore into Crushed Ore, giving bonus yields as well as XP Nuggets. The XP can be cashed in at any time, but you might need it more later...
2) It's an improved mill. Any recipe the Millstone has, the Crushing Wheels can do too, and usually with bonus yields.

3) It has some unique processing recipes. In general, if a stone has a "sand" version of it, if you can expect to be able to crush the item into its sand. It can also extract special dusts out of many different blocks. This is similiar to the Grinder, but the big difference is that Crushing Wheels crush whole blocks into dust, while the Grinder grinds items.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests5.desc: Effectively a minor upgrade to Iron, except with a major enchanting bonus allowing for easy God-tier enchants.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests6.titl: We're Gonna Need a Bigger Crafter...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests6.subt: Probably shouldn't launch that Rocket from some grass.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests6.desc: A large Mechanical Crafting setup will be needed for this recipe. With it crafted, you've got yourself the perfect base to launch a rocket from.
You'll need two - you'll want to leave whichever planet you go to, right?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests7.desc: Boilers - essentially steam power - blow every other kinetic energy source out of the water. They involve a giant Fluid Tank with Water constantly pumped into them and Blaze Burners constantly lit below it. The setup is more complicated to manage, so the Ponder system is recommended.
Aim for a Level 9 Boiler as these are incredibly efficient for their cost. The moment electricity generation enters the room those stress units will be eaten up in no time.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests9.subt: Stop playing Bad Apple on boot, PLEASE
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests10.sub: There are so many uses for this!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests11.des: Deepslate, which could previously be milled for Redstone Dust and Copper Nuggets, can now be &6crushed&r for Zinc Nuggets and Coal!
Consider splitting a conveyor into two to automate both processes at once.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests12.tit: Vegan fuel? Closer than you think!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests12.des: The Plantball will fall apart if sent directly to the Compressor. Pre-press it a bit.
Some Plantballs will break apart, so be ready to dispose or recycle the defects.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests13.des: You do not want ANY impurities in rocket fuel. Wash them away.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests14.des: Welcome to Chapter 3! Things will start feeling truly challenging. Recipe chains will be long and complicated and it will no longer be sufficient to semi-automate or even fully automate basic resources; you will need to automate crafted items such as casings, Electron Tubes, Cables, Cogwheels, and circuits.

However, the Moon provides many invaluable resources for accomplishing this. The bottom path will have irreplacable utilities for managing the logistics of so many resources, while the top paths will give you a glimpse of the world of electricity with new tools to process materials in new ways. Both paths will give methods needed to fully automate any kind of Earth resource you can imagine.

Overcome science and you'll use it to explore the stars above. Don't let the sinking hole of over-engineering trap you though; automation quests are there to tell you something can be automated, not that it must.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests15.des: Both sides of this tree will converge at the end, making them both mandatory.

In this path, you'll explore electricity and specialized machines. Getting rotation power around the base can be made much easier, and although these machines may not impact you as much as the Brass path, they'll become more and more important as you dive deeper into the cosmos.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests16.des: Desh can be obtained through crushing Moon Cobblestone or washing Moon Sand.
Moon Cobblestone will generate infinitely from Stone Growth Chambers in their repsective planets / orbits.
Similar processes can be used in future planets to obtain their ores too.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests17.sub: Deploy Brass Rods, pour Molten Brass and deploy Brass Sheets onto Copper Casing 3 times to craft Brass Casing.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests17.des: Brass Casing is needed for the smartest and most useful of Create machines - Machines with "smart" functionality. It is essential for logistics in large, complicated factories.
Brass Casing is the final tier of casing, at least for Create machines. Future casings from Tech Reborn are more advanced still.
Reminder that Tinkers' Faucets and Create Spouts are fully automatable; don't expose yourself to unnecessary manual labor!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests18.sub: This wasteland is littered with Power Plants... what for?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests18.des: Both sides of this tree will converge at the end, making them both mandatory.
The path of Brass will lead you to the ultimate ends of both the Tinkers' Construct and the Create mod. You'll have every tool you need to fully manage intricate production lines.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests19.des: Lapis Sheets are ingredients in very few recipes, but they have one main use: Integrated Circuits.
A lot of recipes will use Integrated Circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests20.sub: Funny you invent circuits before electricity...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests20.des: Integrated Circuits are used in all sorts of machines.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests21.sub: Those Andesite Casings have come a long way...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests21.des: Machine frames are the basis of many Silver electrical machines. They will also be used to craft even further tiers of casings.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests22.sub: In case you didn't know what batteries do...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests23.sub: Save on some resources this way. Entirely optional.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests23.des: The Create Additions Rolling Mill had its run as being the cool new thing :(
...Just in time for Tesla Coils to be the cool new creative addition.
It will produce Tech Reborn cables and Create Additions cables at an improved rate, but it won't produce Create Additions rods, so do actually keep your Rolling Mill around.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests24.sub: Increase the efficiency of converting tree Sap into Rubber using an Extractor.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests24.des: Many more recipes included to cater for automation of resources. A lot of these are dyes, but there are some useful dyes.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests25.des: Electrical machines allow you to either do new things, or do things more efficiently than ever before.
The Compressor allows you to compress items so hard that they become "plates." It is also strong enough to turn organic matter into fuel.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests26.sub: Use that Canning Machine to load pure Biomatter into liquid form.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests26.des: This is one of the three essential components for spaceflight. The other two are rocket pieces and a workbench to assemble the rocket.
If you wish to store the fuel in Fuel Tanks, you'll need to run the Cell over an Item Drain.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests27.sub: You'll need pretty powerful kinetic sources to make good use of this!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests27.des: The Alternator takes kinetic rotation and produces an electrical charge using magnets.
This energy can be transfered around with cables or wires, and be stored in batteries. Many machines will only operate on electricity.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests28.sub: All your energy can be transferred around with easy-to-use wires now!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests28.des: The Connector attaches to either an energy producer, or an energy consumer. Once attached, a Copper Spool can be attached between them, allowing electricity to be passed around.
The Copper Spool only has so much range. If you need it to travel even farther distances, than you can use Connectors attached to flat surface as a middle point.
Tech Reborn Insulated Cables can also transfer energy around, but are much uglier and clunky.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests29.des: Crouch and Right-Click to open its UI. From there, Biofuel can be deposited. It can store up to three buckets; that being said, it's a smart idea to keep some spare. Being stranded is the worst thing that can happen to you.

Right-Click to enter the rocket. After holding Space for awhile you'll launch off and gain access to a planetary selection system. You can't explore every planet just yet, but you'll still have some new options.

After selecting a location, you'll descend to the planet in a lander. Space will decelerate it. Make sure you do not hit the ground too fast: the lander will explode and you'll be left with no way home. The truly paranoid will take two rockets. F5 can help with the landing process.
Happy space-faring! There's a whole solar system to discover!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests30.sub: Pour Molten Gold over a Fragile Fin to create a cast shape.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests30.des: By casting the Fragile Fin, it will be ready to further process into a more stable material.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests31.tit: I Got Some New Tools for Ya
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests31.sub: These have no durability, are enchantable, but require power as a resource instead!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests31.des: They may not be more powerful than upgraded Tinkers' tools, but enchanting via the old way and keeping them forever can be pretty handy.
A description of what they do is in each relevant quest.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests32.des: The Redstone Chip's specialization in frequency operations turns out to be particularly good for space traveling navigation. It just needs a little more sprucing up so measurements and calculations are as precise as they can be.
There are very few items that need a Navigation Mechanism, but a NASA Workbench is one of them.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests33.sub: It does look tasty, doesn't it.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests33.des: Desh is used in specialized space machinery. Although it won't help your factories, Desh becomes important later on, so you'll want to collect it when you can.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests34.des: It's time to introduce yourself to some porky friends.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests35.sub: If you have plans to base on the Moon or any other celestial body without Oxygen, you'll need to set up an Oxygen Distributor connected to a decent source of Oxygen.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests35.des: By using airlocks and solid blocks, you can stop air from leaking out.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests36.sub: Light up the world with snazzy new lights.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests36.des: Requires an adjacent power source to turn on.
Lamps require Coal Dust, which can be made from the Grinder.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests37.des: Tech Reborn storage units can be upgraded to store many more objects.
With the capability to directly manage resource paths on the bottom path, they can be valuable as final resource resting places.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests38.sub: Uncover the site of a disaster.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests38.des: Evidence of many great technological advances now stand in ruins... There are few signs of any remaining life here.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests39.sub: Only if you like keeping colors consistent.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests39.des: Scorched Tables! These cute little things act slightly differently to regular seared components, in that they REQUIRE a cast before they will accept any kind of recipe.

This is both limiting (can't cast some items such as Iron Bars) but also incredibly useful (you can leave a faucet Redstone-powered and not worry about coming back to your reinforcement automator with 10 stacks of Iron Bars in the Chest)
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests40.tit: Gather for a More Efficient Smeltery
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests40.sub: Find Scoria within the Moon's caverns.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests40.des: This still-warm block can only be found on the Moon, and will be needed to make bigger melting systems than those puny Melters.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests41.sub: Get yourself a Tinkers' multiblock Foundry
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests41.des: The Foundry is capable of smelting at even higher levels of efficiency compared to the Melter, and produces secondary metals when melting.

Not only that, but Foundries operate as a Fluid Tank that can store multiple fluids. They can work with Smart Pipes, too. It won't be the best way to organize fluids but this feature may be handy to you.

For instructions on how to build one, read both these guides. Do note that this modpack skips over "Smelteries" entirely, which the light gray book deals with. Both Smelteries and Foundries have a lot in common though, and both books will teach you the best tool materials and upgrades available to you.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests45.sub: By using a Create Additions Tesla Coil, you can electrify these Synthetic Redstone Crystals as a renewable source of Redstone Dust.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests45.des: The recipe doesnt show in REI, it will work regardless.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests46.tit: These chests are just getting silly...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests46.sub: How many slots does a man really need?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests46.des: One slot is all you need, but technology is about having MORE THAN YOU NEED!!!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests47.sub: Learn the resources you can find on the Moon.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests48.sub: Orbit dimensions have a 1:8 block travel ratio, just like the &mNether&r.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests48.des: It might be worth setting up an outpost for fast travel, as planets are only 1:2.
Also, it's really awesome to live in space.

Be alert that the space station does not come with Oxygen generation or distribution capabilities. You will have to set it up yourself after it's made. That, and you can crash your lander into this space station. Don't do that.
&6You might be even able to find some structures from a time before us...&r
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests49.des: Seed Oil, which our Biofuel will be derived from, is made by compressing seeds. There are many seeds to choose from, so automate whichever one makes the most sense to you.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests50.des: Seed Oil will need to be mixed with plant matter in order to coalesce. Too many nutrients will interfere with the chemistry, so your options are limited.
You can take advantage of an existing tree farm to automate leaves. This will require a way to restock it with shears however.

A grass farm might be simpler, especially since you won't need to hotpatch your tree farm. However, you'll still need a Deployer with shears, and you will also need to find a way to deploy bone meal to grass as well.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests51.des: Mixing Seed Oil and plant material will clump it into a loose organic compound that can be refined further.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests52.tit: We're Going to Burn Dead Things
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests52.sub: Just some final processing to do.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests52.des: Use the Compressor. It smells like MacDonalds.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests53.des: Biomass can be refined into Biomatter Pellets, a very efficient solid fuel source to power Furnaces and other such machines. It might be worth using some Biomatter for this, or coming back to this recipe once there is excess rocket fuel.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests55.des: Tesla Coils are unique in that they operate like kinetic machines, but they use electricity.
The low current but high voltage they produce can be used to provide a current to materials that can ionize into something different. Nice!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests56.des: Brass Funnels operate like Andesite Funnels except for two important distinctions: they can filter what what they take or give, and they can input or output up to a whole stack at a time.
Certain contraptions can operate on entire stacks at a time such as bulk washing, haunting, and blasting, although be aware that more time is needed to process stacks.
Vaults are also made much more useful. Having Vaults output entire stacks of a material onto a Depot can be a great way to have you ready to pick up goodies.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests57.des: Remember how niche Andesite Tunnels were, especially since Chutes were the only way to get stacks onto a Belt?

Tunnels allow you to filter items onto different branches at a Belt intersection. Not only that, but if you put adjacent Brass Tunnels on top of adjacent Belts, they can split the stack evenly or round-robin, allowing you divide up where resources go on the fly.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests58.des: Smart Chutes are like normal Chutes, except that you can filter what gets dumped and by how much.
They can also be turned on and off by Redstone signal. This, in combination with Threshold Switches, can make for an effective way to get rid of excess items in a single inventory.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests59.des: Mechanical Arms can take items off of Belts and Depots and put them somewhere else, including other Depots and Belts, as well as into Funnels.
They're great if setting up Belts is too complicated if you only need to move an item by six feet, or you need items to go onto diverging paths/converging endpoints.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests60.sub: This makes a mockery of engineering.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests60.des: The Rotation Speed Controller lets you set the speed of rotation. It needs a large Cogwheel on top to work.
It's as useful as it sounds. You'll want a couple of these.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests61.sub: Great with Sequenced Gearshifts, and Threshold Switches, and, and, and...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests61.des: A Redstone Link will transmit a Redstone signal wirelessly. They must be set to receive or broadcast with a Wrench, and the wireless channel is determined by the combination of items in its two slots.
They're lifesavers for anything involving Redstone, and are especially helpful when used in combination with Sequenced Gearshifts and Threshold Switches.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests62.sub: The Observer recipes were so cursed!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests62.des: Certain Chapter 2 recipes are now simpler. Even if Brass is a bit rarer, the simplified recipes are a huge ease of mind.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests63.sub: These Gearshifts let you overengineer everything!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests63.des: Sequenced Gearshifts let you you specify a sequence of rotations. For example, when it receives a Redstone signal, it can rotate something exactly 60 degrees, regardless of output speed specified.
They can work on Mechanical Bearings. There's also a few items that were actually available to you all along, but don't make a lot of sense to use without Sequenced Gearshifts.

Of course, having blocks move around doesn't help you too much. There is one exception though: you need a way to keep all that air in your Moon base from leaking out, yeah? Until you can build airlocks, Sequenced Gearshifts are the most reliable way to lock air.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests64.des: The Grinder is like the Millstone: it crushes things down to a more reduced form.

This Grinder specializes in precision and sharpness. It can efficiently grind up any resources that can fit within it. This improves yields for some objects! There's also unique materials that can only be made from this machine. Granted, most of them are dusts that don't help you out at the moment.

It's similiar to the Crushing Wheel from the bottom path. The difference is that the Crushing Wheel operates on whole blocks, while the Grinder operates on individual items. Sometimes there is overlap between these two machines, however.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests65.des: A LOT of machinery uses Silver Plates. This stuff is more valuable than Gold.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests66.des: There are a few solids that can only be turned into liquids when contained in an air-tight cell. The Canning Machines allow you to do this.
There's very few items that require this though, but there's one you might need.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests67.sub: This allows you to move things back and forth.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests67.des: The Gantry Shaft allows you to push connected structures back and forth along a connected "gantry".
Combined with a Sequenced Gearshift, this allows you to create contraptions such as elevators and moving platforms.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests68.sub: This allows you to move things back and forth.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests68.des: The Rope Pulley can be lowered and will attach to connected structures. It can also move structures up and down.
Combined with a Sequenced Gearshift, it can be used to make an elevator, or to vertically transport inventories.

Very inventive engineers might be able to make a quarry with this, as machines like Drills work on structures being moved around via Rope Pulleys much like they do on Mechanical Bearings, Trains, and Cart Contraptions. This applies to Pistons and Gantries too.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests69.sub: This allows you to move things back and forth.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests69.des: The Mechanical Piston can be push connected contraptions forwards. The sticky version can push them back and forth. They resemble regular Minecraft Pistons, although their range can be made longer than their Redstone counterpart.
Combined with a Sequenced Gearshift, they can be used to make elevators. Weird how that works.
(A lowkey practical use for them is pushing blocks made in a Cobblestone or Basalt Generator to a Drill placed in a more convenient spot.)
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests70.tit: Let's Set Up Fuel Production Line
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests70.sub: You can start production of rocket fuel early if you want!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests70.des: Rocket biofuel is a difficult process, especially with the technology you have available to you. Automating it will test your factory-building skills, but the stars beckon you to discover a new age within them.
Although you can do this as you complete the chapter, you will need certain tools from both sides of the tree in order to complete this challenge.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests71.des: The Desh Plate is needed in many manners of space utilities and crafts.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests72.sub: Will melt you and electrocute you!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests72.des: Electrum has limited technical applications, mostly for finely-modulated electric currents in circuity that specializes in waves.
It's normally used as an equipment material. Tinkers' tools made with this give you more experience than usual! After all, you did go through a lot of experience to come this far.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests73.sub: Hey, did you know that you can make Magma Blocks out of these?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests73.des: You can make Nether Grout out of it too.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests74.sub: Nether means 'Nether one of my b****es
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests75.des: Much like what Seared Bricks are to Melters, Scorched Bricks are the foundation of many Foundry blocks.
You will need a lot more of these then you will Seared Bricks, however. Foundries are made block by block, and you'll probably want to build big.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests76.des: Scorched Bricks form the walls of a Foundry. Literally. You place them down in a hollow cube and place the Controller in one of them to complete the multiblock.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests77.sub: For when chucking stuff into the top doesn't work.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests77.des: The Scorched Chute can have a Funnel attached to it and be used to input items into the Foundry. Useful if you have an ore processing setup.
By the way, you can insert items manually via the Foundry Controller, this block is only needed for automation purposes.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests78.tit: Get Fluids in and out the Foundry
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests78.sub: You stick it right into the side!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests78.des: A Scorched Drain will let you pump fluids into and out of the Foundry with Create Pipes.
By the way, buckets can work on this block for inputing or extracting fluids manually.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests79.sub: The Foundry has special power methods.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests79.des: These two items can store up to four buckets of any fluid. They can also be picked up and moved around. This has its own uses.
However, their biggest purpose is to act as fuel input to the Foundry. Foundries powered by Lava will melt the fastest with great fuel efficiency. You'll want one in your Foundry.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests80.des: Foundries can be built pretty high. It may be handy to look into them - or even better, have a ladder out of them for when you fall in.
Scorched Ladders can be build as part of the Foundry wall while keeping the multiblock structure valid. Handy.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests81.des: The Grinder is superior at grinding items. Because of this, a few items - even if they can be milled or crushed - will have their greatest yield from this machine.
The tasks above are a few examples.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests82.des: Soul Soil has a surprising number of uses. It's needed for Foundries, Basalt generators, and a special form of processing called "haunting". Huh!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests83.sub: Access a new form of material processing
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests83.des: The Soul Campfire has a unique property. When placed in front of an Encased Fan, it will begin to "bulk haunt" items similarly to bulk smelting and bulk washing. Items that undergo haunting transform into an alternate or "corrupted" version of themselves. It's really handy for getting stuff that may be a bit hard to find, and has many unusual applications in automation!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests84.sub: This is a children's game, obviously.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests84.des: Most mobs trapped inside an active Foundry will bleed Blood into the Foundry. The Blood can then be cast into balls that function like Slimeballs.

You can't move Spawners in this game, but setting up a Foundry around one you discovered can make for a great Slimeball automation alternative. You can even set up a Train to periodically deliver Blood to your base if the nearest Spawner is far away!
Alternatively, Slime can be automated by automating Lime Dye and Dough, if this setup is too much for you. This quest will accept either approach.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests85.des: You can build a Foundry around a Blaze Spawner, and it'll cook the Blazes into Blazing Blood. There are also many crafting recipes to produce it, use REI to find them! Blazing Blood can be converted to Blaze Rods, or used to power the Foundry.
Alternatively, you could just keep the Blazing Blood as an alternative to Lava for powering the Foundry. It is faster at melting!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests86.sub: Not as valuable as silver though.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests86.des: Soul Sand and Soul Soil can be washed into Golden Nuggets (and Quartz!). Soul Sand can also be made by haunting Sand - you might have a better way to automate Sand later in this chapter...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests87.sub: This isn't magic in a tech pack.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests87.des: The tasks listed here are a few examples of what can be gained via haunting. Play around!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests88.sub: Want to see what areas aren't lit well enough?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests88.des: Craft a Peculiar Bell with Brass which is a little down the quest line the other way, and then haunt it for a Haunted Bell. This bell has a unique property - when rung, it will show spirits where mobs can spawn at night. This utility is perfect for mob-spawn-proofing your base!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests89.sub: The top path did tell you to automate this...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests89.des: Remember Asurine? What you milled for Zinc? Well, not only does crushing it give you extra Zinc, it will also create "Lazurite Dust". Lazurite, combined with Lava and some Iron, will create Lapis.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests90.sub: Just how many uses does Clay have?!?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests90.des: Silver can be obtained by washing the Lime byproduct obtained by crushing Limestone.
It also appears as a byproduct in Desh automation.
Consider creating a Limestone generator if you haven't already!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests91.des: Lava touching Soul Soil and Blue Ice will create Basalt. The Basalt can then be mined, much like a Cobblestone generator setup.
Basalt can be processed to directly yield many useful resources.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests93.des: Take note of which new recipes are available to make in the near-future by viewing all &6Mechanical Crafting&r recipes in REI!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests94.sub: Don't ingest this, it ain't coal coke.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests94.des: Coal (Carbon) can be mixed with Iron to create very sturdy Steel. The Grinder from the Silver path and the Crushing Wheel can produce an equal amount of Coal Dust.
If you have very little Coal on you, Charcoal can be converted to Coal via bulk haunting.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests95.des: Steel is an alloy made to be significantly stronger than pure Iron. You'll definitely need it for more industrial applications.
Steel will have a lot more relevance in Chapter 4. For now, it's vital for getting there in the first place.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests96.sub: This doesn't make the bucket blast resistant, just the cement in it.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests96.des: To make Blast-Resistant Cement, Steel and Lime Dust needs to be mixed together with Concrete Powder.
Clay Dust for the Concrete Powder can be obtained by crushing Limestone, or crushing Clay. The material is too soft for the Grinder to work.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests97.sub: More useful then you might realize!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests97.des: Lastly, all you need to do is pour the Cement into a Casting Basin.
Blast-Resistant Concrete is the only material strong enough to withstand the blast of a rocket, while still being cheap enough to obtain in the quantities you need.

That being said, you'll want to build your landing sites out of this. Rockets can blow up if you don't land them correctly, and this concrete block will prevent those mishaps from destroying part of your base.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests98.sub: Read this if you're a Tinkers' Construct expert.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests98.des: If you've played modded MC before, you probably know high-tier Tinkers' alloys are made with either the Smeltery or the Alloy Mixer. Both of these have been removed. Instead, all Tinkers' Constructs alloys are now mixed with heated Basins.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests99.sub: They're kind of important to technology!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests99.des: Not only are Integrated Circuits used in many machines in the near future, but much like casings, they are a tiered object. You will create more advanced circuits from Integrated Circuits.
Of course, you can get far with only semi-automating it.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests100.ti: The Third or Fourth Kinetic Source!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests100.su: Electricity can be turned back into kinetic energy
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests100.de: Electric motors do the reverse of alternators: they take electricity and turn it into rotational power. There's a conversion loss made when doing this - you'll only use 75%% of energy that was made with the alternator. Despite that, wires solve all sorts of issues with gear shifts and axis transfering. Plus, later on you'll have access to powerful electrical generators that may replace traditional kinetic sources entirely.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests101.su: I mean, what else would you use Diamonds for?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests101.de: Diamond-grit Sand Paper is far more efficient than regular Sand Paper. Although you will have to say goodbye to one of your Diamonds to get Diamond Dust, it's worth not having to replace your Sand Paper every five seconds.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests102.de: One special resource the Grinder can produce is Gunpowder from Dried Kelp. Although we're not expecting you to use a lot of TNT, Gunpowder may have a helpful role in creating a special blue rock...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests103.de: Crushing Limestone will give you Lime, a necessary ingredient for creating Big-Boy Concrete!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests104.su: These have been popping up more and more.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests104.de: With a steady source of Blaze Powder and a source of Slime (alternative or otherwise), you now have a path to make Obsidian by cooling Magma Blocks.
Sturdy Sheets become more and more relevant, and are pretty important to the Silver path. You may want to consider automating them.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests105.de: The drill acts like an all-purpose pickaxe.
The Jackhammer functions as an efficient pickaxe, except that it's the lowest tier of tool. That is, it can only mine rocks, not ores.
Craft whichever looks the most interesting to you.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests108.de: The Rockcutter acts as a Diamond Pickaxe with Silk Touch.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests109.de: The Accumulator really does act like a giant battery. Its tooltip has more information about how it works.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests110.de: This handy box will charge batteries and power tools, thus making your tools truly reusable.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests111.ti: What a Steel of a deal!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests111.su: Hope our overuse of Steel puns doesn't weigh you down.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests111.de: Pressing Steel Dust in a heated Basin will coat your Sturdy Armor in a layer of Steel!
It is equivalent to Diamond, and worth making for the aesthetic alone...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests113.su: In case you wondering how to automate Desh.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests113.de: Much like generating other celestial stones, Moon Stone can be farmed in the Stone Growth Chamber on the Moon. This wouldn't be helpful on its own, but now you can crush Moon Stone into Moon Sand to be washed.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests114.ti: How do I input/output from these machines?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests114.su: A quick crash course on how to automate these funny little blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests114.de: By default all sides of Tech Reborn machines are LOCKED. To adjust this you will need to open the block's GUI and click the wrench icon.
You now get to manually configure all individual slots to have a direction input/output based on which sides you wanted to use Funnels to input those items from.
This remedies the age old issue default blocks have in which predetermined input/output directions for specific slots limit automation design *heavily*.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests116.su: Perhaps a blueprint from a lost civilization might hold the mechanics to build this thing...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests116.de: Hint: There is a low chance on most high tier loot chests for any blueprint, however one is guaranteed atop a certain &6Telecommunications Tower&r on the Moon...
All blueprints can be &6Duplicated&r through compacting in a basin, once you have obtained the first copy.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests118.su: Pedal-powered craft fueled by hunger rather than coal...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests119.su: Difficult to control but uncontested for long-range flights...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests120.su: Bulky, but comes with storage capability.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests121.de: With heated Basins, you can now automatically make potions.
This might have a few more uses than vanilla.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests123.de: Simply place your post-drilled Breech onto the floor, and introduce it by hand (or automate with Deployers) to a Create Shaft followed by a Screw Lock.
You'll need to cast the Steel Ingots required in a Screw Lock or pour it yourself using a Ring Cast for a slightly reduced material cost!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests124.su: If you've dipped your toes into Big Cannons, this is essentially free...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests124.de: Follow the REI prompts backwards to work your way through drilling an Incomplete Steel Screw Breech.
Sometimes military war game mods aren't so optional after all...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests125.su: I am a dwarf and I'm boring a hole.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests125.de: Attach the Breech to a Mechanical Bearing. Placing a Cannon Drill with at least enough Extension Poles to propel it far enough into the Breech (when provided with rotational power) will allow you to drill straight through.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests126.su: Simply use a Create Press to condense the Fin back to its sturdy makeup.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests127.su: Weaken some Sturdy Sheets in a Grinder.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests128.su: The Dark Side of the Moon
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests128.de: The ruins of the Moon, swallowed and regurgitated... Thrown up into the air like a great beast playing with its food.
With a &6Desh Rocket&r, we can see what lies in the &3Moon Debris&r beyond orbit. Bring your finest gear - there's a terrible aura filling the air here, and things will get hostile very quickly.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests129.de: The Monsters here, corrupted by something living, something evil.
The &3Crystals&r they form when defeated... are clearly not of this world. What caused this damage?
Reality itself seems to disagree with whatever grazed civilization on the Moon, yet... There's something so beautiful about the scars it left.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests130.de: Our modern technology and alien matter, combined to form something of great use.
The &3Pylon&r permits teleportation to a set location, as long as the user doesn't step beyond 256 blocks of it.
Once a &3Pylon&r is active, Right-Click to teleport, or Shift + Right-Click to detonate for a strong burst of knockback.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests131.de: The &3Crystals&r can be formed into a ball for a devastating projectile.
If a Cometball hits an enemy, it will launch them into the air. Throw the &3Cometball&r while looking straight down to hit yourself, allowing for air maneuverablity at the cost of your health.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests132.de: Whatever happened here... it left spores... it formed life...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests134.de: Shimmer-colored decor that functions in a few recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests135.de: You can use this to store your XP before going out on adventures, or you can use it to give XP to friends!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests136.su: No need to Shulk about it :(
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests136.de: Use Shulker Shells to make Shulker Boxes. Place these down like a chest and store items. Break the block and you will be able to carry a whole inventory in one slot.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests137.su: We have provided some... &6alternative ammo types&r for you to shoot from potato cannons.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests137.de: All of these projectiles have different projectile properties, try them all and see which is your favourite tool of destruction!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests138.de: Right-Click to set a location. Right-Click again to teleport there.
This item has unlimited range and &6works cross-dimension&r. However, it will break upon use.
I'm not even going to explain the recipe for this one. An item like this is complicated to forge. Good luck.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests139.de: You may stumble upon a &dShimmer Heart&r in a storage crate - left behind from cruel experimentation...
To reawaken it would be... cruel...
When thrown into a pool of Shimmer, the &dAwakened Shimmer Heart&r will glow. Globs of Shimmer will chunk together to form a &dPowerful Creature&r. It will not take kindly to you reawakening it.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_4.quests140.de: &aXP Crystal&r Lakes spawn rarely underground on the Moon. A crust of hardened XP will surround a pool of &bLiquid Soul&r.

&aBudding XP Crystals&r feed off of &bLiquid Soul&r through the sides of the block, producing &aXP Crystals&r on the top and bottom of the block when they get hungry. &bLiquid Soul&r is automatable, so keep those crystals growing!
&aXP Crystals&r can be eaten for &aXP&r, or they can be melted and processed into &aXP Boost&r potions, and various foods that grant large quantities of &aXP&r when digested.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.title: 4) Piglin Peculiarities
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests0.subt: Make yourself at home, it only gets worse from here...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests0.desc: A resilient civilization inhabits Mars... They seem to worship Gold. Find large quantities of it along with Lead and Ostrum in the underground. Buildings, old and new, can be found on the surface.

As you've proven your resourcefulness up to now, the quests will be slightly less thorough, and may not tell you every new tool you gained when you craft a new machine. This totally has nothing to do with two different writers writing different halves of the pack. Nope. Not at all.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests1.subt: Let us put that &bHellfire&r to good use, shall we?
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests1.desc: Access to your new fuel will allow the &6Foundry&r to become &bSUPERHEATED&r!

This new heat threshold of 3000*C will allow most future ores to be melted down into molten goodness, which can then be cast as ingots and plates. Ostrum, especially, is going to be integral in creating a rocket and protective equipment to survive the dangerous conditions as we approach ever-closer to the Sun...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests2.subt: Pour Lithium into your Red Cell Batteries for this component.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests2.desc: Lithium can be processed from basic Clay balls for a large amount, if you use one of the earlier Clay farms.
A reminder that batteries can be charged in any Tech Reborn machine! The Tesla Coil from Create Additions does not provide this.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests3.subt: This isn't a dodgy Astral multiblock, it's a fully fledged machine block.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests3.desc: A swathe of recipes are available in the electrolyzer, from separating Tech Reborn fluids to their base components, to converting items like Clay and Coal Dust into &6Lithium and Carbon Cells respectively&r.
Those two recipes mention at the tail-end of the first sentence are worth knowing, and getting produced already, before you will start using it for further manufacturing.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests4.desc: An upgrade to your humble space-suit. How enticing! This suit will be &6mandatory&r for exploration on Mercury, as the ambient temperature would rip through your basic suit like kindling.
You'll need a &6Shimmer Amplifier&r and &6Orange Stained Glass&r for these! Take note of the latter as it catches many off guard.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests5.subt: Combining everything we have learnt so far.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests5.desc: Not everyone makes it this far, you know.
You are about to assemble your second rocket, utilizing all the components made up to this point. Quite a thrill!
Preparing for &6Mercury&r should be of utmost priority. Enemies there will not spare you if you slack, so be sure to get protection on your suit if you haven't already!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests6.desc: To survive on Mercury with it's super hot surface temperature, ensure you are wearing the Lead-lined Space Suit at all times!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests7.desc: The recipe you've been using so far for Steel Dust is rather low output for its cost.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests8.subt: Discover the biomes of this treacherous climate.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests9.desc: Much like certain desktop CPUs, the new chip that's our goal will need pins to connect to its motherboard, whether that may be a washing machine or a high-end gaming PC is irrelevant.
To create pins you will need to put Gold Nuggets into a Rolling Machine, which will result in normal pins. We don't want the normal pins though, we want special ones, electrified ones.
Create these Electrified Pins by putting the normal ones on a depot below a Tesla Coil, which will charge them up.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests10.sub: I thought these were assembly items.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests10.des: So, you have pre-emptively applied all the Electrified Pins on the mechanism.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests11.sub: A new tier of chips with high demand.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests11.des: A simple process to finish the recipe chain, just apply a &6Lead Plate&r and &6Press&r to form your new circuit!
A majority of Tech Reborn machine blocks will be utilizing these chips, and they will have uses in later chapters for further tiered items.
Don't slack on your automation! You've made it this far, after all.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests12.des: The &6Centrifuge&r is an integral tool at your disposal. Use it to turn items, Tech Reborn Cells and more into their base components with a little bit of time and Energy input.
From here, you have multiple paths to branch into, however they will converge eventually, feel free to focus on them one at a time, or all at once!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests13.sub: Electrolysing Clay Dust produces Lithium liquid, which can be utilized to upgrade Red Cell Batteries.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests14.des: &6Molten Iron Cells&r mixed with &6Carbon Cells&r (Obtained by electrolysing Coal or Charcoal) will produce four Steel Dust in a blast furnace.
This is over 2x the efficiency of the prior recipe per resource spent!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests15.sub: Get a load of this stuff!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests15.des: Crushing Infernal Spire produces Netherite Scrap Debris at a low rate.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests16.des: Semi-automatable Debris! Wow! Along with its usual usages, Netherite can be used to forge some devastating MC Dungeons weapons. If you're rolling in the stuff, Create Deco provides some pricey decoration blocks. - Happy flexing
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests17.des: Now that you've got electrified pins it is time to add them to the chip.
However, they are very small and delicate, which means that human precision is not enough. You will need to apply the pins to an integrated circuit in an assembly line using deployers.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests18.des: A component use in &6Vital Rocket Assembly Parts&r.
Various fluid you've interacted with before, alongside &6Fire-Resistant Fragile Sheet Blocks&r will assemble into this component.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests19.sub: As a bonus for getting this far, here is a block of Liquid Diamond. A treat >.<
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests19.des: 64 Coal Dust in an Implosion Compressor will create a Diamond. Seems steep, but such is the price we pay for automation.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests20.des: Gold can be found in structures here, but it's important to set up Gold automation using Ochrum!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests21.sub: &6Respect the Piglin's Religion, and they may opt to bargain with you.&r
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests21.des: The Piglins worship Gold like a god. Show off your respect by holding a token of faith.
A bar of Gold as a body... nugget for a nose... two little pins for arms... sand it off and... yes, that should do it.
Once you've established a common ground with your piggy kin, you may begin trading.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests22.des: Toss a coin at a piglin, like a wish in a well. Piglins love themselves and Gold. Expect big rewards.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests23.sub: Google Piglin inflation to find out more!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests23.des: Pig-Iron can be made by putting a pork chop, an Iron Ingot, and a Gold Ingot in a heated Mixer.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests24.tit: You spin my head right round...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests24.sub: I don't like where this is going...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests24.des: Methane has a strange effect on the mind and body. When inhaled, it fogs weak minds, making one suggestable to even the most preposterous of ideas.
...I wonder if it has the same effect on Piglins?
It can be produced by placing lots of decomposable items in an Industrial Centrifuge, like 16 Wood, as an example.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests25.sub: Observe a Piglin in their natural habitat, Bastions or Piglin Towers.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests25.des: Piglins love to trade Gold Coins! They can't resist give you lots of goodies in return.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests26.sub: One out of two, although the second is still out of reach...
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests26.des: Lead acts as any other ore you've seen so far would. It can be &6Crushed, smelted, melted down&r without trouble.
Pockets of Ostrum may catch your eye on Mars, ensure to collect them for further research, I know just the thing to process them, &bbut it will require some real heat...&r
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests27.sub: OK, you may use the Press for this one :)
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests27.des: &6Desh&r is tough, and requires a Compressor to turn into sheets. However, Lead is highly malleable, so kinetic energy and a big block of Iron will be plenty to form sheets of it.
Simply throw it into whatever highly sophisticated Mechanical Press setup you have!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests28.des: Why is there Methane in this? Is this ethical?
Either way, Piglin Fortunes unlock a higher tier of trading. It would be very rewarding to automate these. Just throw at a Piglin and they won't be able to resist!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests29.des: Piglins love Gold, so a gift for them should be presented in a Golden Bowl.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests30.sub: Mushrooms are a hell of a drug.
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests30.des: A gift to remind the Piglins of their home. They're gonna love this!
ftbquests.chapter.chapter_5.quests31.des: The Shimmer Amplifier will play a primary role in the mechanical crafting of Ostrum Engines.
